Package com.j2igf.framework.core

Class Window

java.lang.Object
com.j2igf.framework.core.Window
public final class Window extends Object
This class is used to create a window and render to it.
Author:
Aryan Rai

  • Constructor Details

    • Window

      public Window(String title, int width, int height, int pixelScale)
      This is the constructor of the Window class. It creates a window with the specified title, width, height and pixelScale.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the window. If null, the title will be set to "Untitled".
      width - The width of the window. If less than or equal to 0, the window will be fullscreen. If greater than the maximum width of the screen, the width will be set to the maximum width of the screen.
      height - The height of the window. If less than or equal to 0, the window will be fullscreen. If greater than the maximum height of the screen, the height will be set to the maximum height of the screen.
      pixelScale - The scale of each pixel of the window. Example: If pixelScale is 2, each pixel will be 2x2 pixels. If less than or equal to 0, the pixelScale will be set to 1.

  • Method Details

      This method disposes the window.

      This method sets the custom close operation of the window.
      Parameters:
      closeOperation - The custom close operation.

    • getFrameBuffer

      public int[] getFrameBuffer()
      This method gets the frame buffer of the window.
      Returns:
      The frame buffer of the window as an int[] that can be modified.
